hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Transition via Volatility Compression Break
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime with 20-day realized volatility below 40% and 10-day ATR compression to <1.5% of price, a downside break of the 20-day Bollinger Band lower bound (2 std) on >1.5x average volume signals a high-probability transition to BEAR regime, with mean reversion failing within 48 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low volatility in neutral regimes often precedes directional breaks. High-volume breaks of technical bounds during compression suggest institutional positioning shifts. Failed mean reversion after 48 hours confirms regime change rather than noise.
entry_conditions: BTC price closes below 20-day Bollinger Band lower bound (2 std)
Volume on break day > 1.5x 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns above 20-day SMA within 48 hours (failed break)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price drops >8% below entry without returning above SMA
exit_conditions.time_exit: Hold for 5 days, exit if no further 3% move in direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: >65% of such signals see price return above SMA within 48 hours (mean reversion prevails, no regime change).
